title: Kazbegi National Park
about: Kazbegi National Park - located in Kazbegi municipality, Mtskheta-Mtianeti region, in the historical ravine on the northern slopes of the Caucasus Mountains. The total area of ​​Kazbegi National Park is 9030 ha. Only 35% of the national park is covered by forest, while the rest is occupied by alpine ridges, moraines, ever-snow-capped peaks, and inaccessible cliffs. These cliffs and mountains are home to many rare and unique species of animals and birds. Kazbegi National Park is mountainous. Its lowest point is 1,400 meters above sea level.
